lexUnit.name: accentuate.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to place emphasis on something

sentence.text: The rejection of the newly mobile toddler may be accentuated if another baby is born at this time .

The three figures looked quite awful ; someone had painted red , blue and green panties over the mid-sections of the figures perhaps to register objection to their nudity , but this only served to accentuate it .
The military government believed elections were imperative to accentuate consolidation of the rightists and that the elections should be followed by the extension of Koreanisation .
Working till midnight accentuates the stress rather than relieves it .
The coincidence naturally accentuated suspicion even among officials more intrepid than Valuev , whose own chambers were scorched .
Increasingly widespread use probably accentuated a chronic shortage of coin .
MARK BAILEY accentuates the positive , and explains how to overcome the negatives of keeping synspilum -- a real tank-buster of a cichlid .

Television helped both main challengers project themselves as serious and qualified candidates for the presidency , while accentuating the contrast between their youthfulness and the tired , out-of-touch grandfather in the Elysée .
One important effect of this conflict appears to have been to accentuate what many economists already saw as a serious drift on the part of the OECD world into recession .
Several times Lawrence and colleagues accentuate the damaging effect of treatment on patients with cancer of the prostate .

This irony was only accentuated by the refugees ' initial belief that their exile was to be brief , a few days perhaps , at most a month , after which -- in the manner of other civilians who had abandoned their homes in the midst of battle -- they would return to their houses and fields to resume the life which had been interrupted by war .
The Republican strategy of the past generation has been to confront such differences and accentuate them .
In fact , it accentuates the lavishly comic-book style and ironic wit of the whole film .

Turning to Egor he requests more body parts and , to accentuate the urgency required , he physically hurls our hunchbacked hero from the top of his castle into the graveyard below where the game begins .
This need was accentuated by the extension of the Institute 's training scheme to non-practising organisations and into the European Community .
